intro: Hieraciodes raulinii, commonly known as the Raulin's hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in temperate climates. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed, and it produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
